full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 782 Filed 01/15/25 Page 68 of 158 68 LBAAMAX3ps Rocchio - Direct
1 A. I'm sorry. I'm referring to the list of behaviors specifically that are under the category entitled "Victim Selection."
2 Q. Thank you.
3 MS. POMERANTZ: Can we turn to page 4.
4 Q. And directing your attention to the table on page 4, what does this table show and how does that impact your view on vulnerabilities?
5 A. So this table shows, again, specific behaviors that there's widespread agreement in this particular group of professionals that are relevant to a particular stage of the grooming process. And, again, these are also behaviors that have been commonly and repeatedly found to exist in the scientific literature as being associated with the grooming process.
6 Q. And how does the information on this table compare to the table we were just looking at?
7 A. There are similar types of behaviors that can be done in the service of building a relationship of trust and attachment, and in -- and have been found to be utilized by offenders. But there was not as much agreement among the professionals that these specific behaviors -- about the relevance of these specific behaviors and/or the stage to which they were part of.
8 MS. POMERANTZ: Thank you. Ms. Durocher, we can pull that down.
9 Q. Dr. Rocchio, the defense has stated that your opinion that
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
